title: Destiny of the Daleks
dialogue_triumphs: Doctor: 'I want to get a closer look at that body…'
dialogue_disasters: 'Seek – Locate – Exterminate!' Banal even by Dalek standards.
goofs: Davros sways alarmingly as the Doctor pushes him down the corridor.
During one of Davros's rants about his 'perfect' creations in episode three, one of them can be seen adjusting the top half of its casing.
A Dalek crashes into a door frame.
The Daleks say that self-sacrifice is illogical, so why do they go on a suicide mission in episode four?
In 'scissors cut paper' there is no logically superior choice so the Movellans should not be trapped in the game as they are.
The Doctor gives Romana a bleeper to tell her when to take her radiation tablets but forgets to give her any of the actual pills.

additional_notes: Fashion Victims: The Movellans: silver dreadlocks and skin-tight one-piece 'space-suits'.
bottom_line: Despite some interesting visuals, 'Destiny' has a tacky, inconsequential feel that comes from a decade of having its best jokes sneered at. After a while it becomes difficult to work out where Nation's plot ends, and Adams' script-editing, complete with Hitch-Hikers in-jokes, begins.
